content.rendered:
7 June 2018 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Mark McNeil Cassidy as country manager in Qatar.

Mark McNeil Cassidy is a master mariner with 31 years’ seagoing experience, 24 years of which have been in the offshore oil and gas industry and five years in shore-based consultancy.

Mark Cassidy joins AqualisBraemar from a role with Global Maritime in Egypt. He has previously held positions as principal surveyor with DNVGL in Doha, Qatar, and was master with Gulf Offshore North Sea Limited for nine years. 

Mark Cassidy will head up AqualisBraemar’s office in Doha, Qatar, reporting to regional director Middle East, Ben Lazenby.

AqualisBraemar is a specialised marine and offshore engineering consultancy focusing on the shallow and deep-water offshore segments of the offshore oil and gas industry. The company is part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA. Its core services includes concept, FEED and basic design engineering for upgrades and conversions of jack-ups, rigs and other fixed offshore installations, rig moving, marine warranty, dynamic positioning and construction supervision services. The company also offers transportation and installation as well as due diligence services.

 

For further information, please contact:

Investors and financial media

Kim Boman, CFO, Aqualis ASA
Telephone: +47 959 63 912
Email: kim.boman@aqualis.no

Other media enquiries

Endre Johansen, Corporate Communications AS
Telephone: +47 41 61 06 05
Email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no

About Aqualis ASA

Aqualis ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers energy consultancy services to the offshore oil, gas and renewables sectors globally. The group employs experienced consultants across 17 offices in 14 countries worldwide. Aqualis ASA operates under two different brands: AqualisBraemar and Offshore Wind Consultants. AqualisBraemar is a specialised offshore marine and engineering consultancy firm, focusing on the shallow and deep-water offshore segments of the oil and gas industry. Offshore Wind Consultants is a globally focused consultancy providing independent services to the offshore renewables industry.

jetpack-related-posts.title: New head of Middle East for Aqualis
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 30 August 2016 – Marine and offshore engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar has appointed Ben Lazenby as director of the company’s Middle East operation, which now counts five offices in four different countries. Ben Lazenby succeeds Reuben Segal, who will now concentrate fully on his role as Chief Operating Officer of AqualisBraemar.…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Qatar office for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 4 September 2015 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar continues to expand its international footprint and opens a new office in Doha, Qatar. AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has opened 16 offices in 11 countries worldwide since its establishment just over two years ago. In the Middle East,…

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar sets up office in Australia
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has set up an office in Perth, Western Australia, to support oil and gas developments in the Australasia region.

jetpack-related-posts.title: New European head for AqualisBraemar
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: AqualisBraemar has appointed Mark Lomas as director of the company’s European operation.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC hires project engineering head
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has hired James Rinkel to head up the development of the company’s project engineering team.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar goes Dutch
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: 1 August 2017 – Offshore marine and engineering consultancy AqualisBraemar, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, is setting up a presence in the Netherlands. In that connection, the group has hired Jasper Bergsma as its head of business development in the country. Bergsma will be based in Amsterdam and in charge…
